008 ******************************************************************************/
009package ImageJ_Demos;
010
011import ij.IJ;
012import ij.ImagePlus;
013import ij.ImageStack;
014import ij.WindowManager;
015import ij.gui.GenericDialog;
016import ij.gui.NewImage;
017import ij.plugin.filter.PlugInFilter;
018import ij.process.Blitter;
019import ij.process.ByteBlitter;
020import ij.process.ByteProcessor;
021import ij.process.ImageProcessor;
022import imagingbook.core.plugin.JavaDocHelp;
023
024/**
025 * This imageJ plugin demonstrates blending of two images
026 * and generating a stack of intermediate images.
027 * At least two images must be open. The active image is 
028 * taken as the first image, the second image may be selected
029 * interactively.
030 * 
031 * @author WB
032 *
033 */
034public class Alpha_Blending_Stack implements PlugInFilter, JavaDocHelp {
035        static int nFrames = 10;
036
037        ImagePlus fgIm = null; // foreground image (chosen interactively)
038        
039        public int setup(String arg, ImagePlus imp) {
040                return DOES_8G;
041        }
042
043        public void run(ImageProcessor bgIp) {
044                if (!runDialog() || fgIm == null) {
045                        return;
046                }
047                
048                int w = bgIp.getWidth();
049                int h = bgIp.getHeight();
050
051                // prepare foreground image
052                ImageProcessor fgIp = fgIm.getProcessor().convertToByte(false);
053                ImageProcessor fgTmpIp = bgIp.duplicate();
054
055                // create image stack
056                ImagePlus movie = NewImage.createByteImage("Movie", w, h, nFrames, 0); 
057                ImageStack stack = movie.getStack();
058
059                // loop over stack frames
060                for (int i = 0; i < nFrames; i++) {
061                        // transparency of foreground image
062                        double iAlpha = 1.0 - (double) i / (nFrames - 1);
063                        ImageProcessor iFrame = stack.getProcessor(i + 1); 
064                        // copy background image to frame i
065                        iFrame.insert(bgIp, 0, 0);
066                        iFrame.multiply(iAlpha);
067
068                        // copy foreground image and make transparent
069                        fgTmpIp.insert(fgIp, 0, 0);
070                        fgTmpIp.multiply(1 - iAlpha);
071
072                        // add foreground image frame \Code{i}
073                        ByteBlitter blitter = new ByteBlitter((ByteProcessor) iFrame);
074                        blitter.copyBits(fgTmpIp, 0, 0, Blitter.ADD);
075                }
076
077                // display movie (image stack)
078                movie.show();
079        }
080        
081        private boolean runDialog() {
082                // get list of open images
083                // TODO: simplify foreground image selection (see matching plugins)
084                int[] windowList = WindowManager.getIDList(); 
085                if (windowList == null) {
086                        IJ.noImage();
087                        return false;
088                }
089                String[] windowTitles = new String[windowList.length];
090                for (int i = 0; i < windowList.length; i++) {
091                        ImagePlus imp = WindowManager.getImage(windowList[i]); 
092                        if (imp != null)
093                                windowTitles[i] = imp.getShortTitle(); 
094                        else
095                                windowTitles[i] = "untitled";
096                }
097                
098                GenericDialog gd = new GenericDialog("Alpha Blending"); 
099                gd.addChoice("Foreground image:", 
100                windowTitles, windowTitles[0]);
101                gd.addNumericField("Frames:", nFrames, 0); 
102                
103                gd.showDialog(); 
104                if (gd.wasCanceled()) 
105                        return false;
106                
107                int img2Index = gd.getNextChoiceIndex(); 
108                fgIm = WindowManager.getImage(windowList[img2Index]);
109                nFrames = (int) gd.getNextNumber(); 
110                if (nFrames < 2)
111                        nFrames = 2;
112                return true;
113        }
114
115}
